result.execSummary:
The defendant August Lawrence Whitebird was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Certify Debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue
of right to seek postconviction relief

Defendant August Lawrence Whitebird in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM29 and 16CT10. State comments-- agreement of the parties. Option 1 of the Offer to settle. Agreement of the parties. 16CM29 Count 2 and 16CT10. understands the 2 charges and potential penalties. PLEADS NC to the Counts. 16CM29 Count 1 is DRI. Signed PQ. No threat or force to plead NC. Understands elements of the crime. Wants Ct to accept pleas of NC. Ct accept pleas and Finds G. Atty comments on sentencing. Ct comments on sentencing
Ct orders-- 
  $10 fine and cost.. $488.88 added to payment plan. DNA within 7 days on both cases

Attorney Mark L Perrine in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Auth filed in both cases. Agreement in cases and need a PLEAS.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2018 at 10:30 am.

Defendant August Lawrence Whitebird in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 3:32pm 2 cases. Atty Perrine no agreement but working toward one, suggests May7  Status conference scheduled for May 7, 2018 at 01:45 pm.
